job_description: Senior Cloud Engineer (AWS - Contract to Hire) - job post Pow Bio Berkeley, CA Contract Apply now Apply now save-icon Job details Job Type Contract About Pow.bio Founded by a UC Berkeley Ph.D. graduate and a SynBio veteran, Pow.bio (https://www.pow.bio/) is revolutionizing the $500B biomanufacturing market by building a self-driving fermenter platform that enables cost-effective scale-up solutions across a wide array of strains, organisms, and products. As a senior cloud engineer on our team, you will be responsible primarily for AWS cloud infrastructure build and support through all phases of the project and cloud services lifecycle. You will have the opportunity to engineer & lead migrations of existing complex solutions to AWS cloud platforms. You will work with the application team to determine what they need in AWS to make sure the deployment is successful. The ideal candidate has past experience leading efforts from on-premise solutions to AWS cloud platforms. You will enjoy keeping your existing technical skills honed and developing new ones, so you can make strong contributions to deep architecture and engineering discussions. Responsibilities Lead the design, development, and evolution of cloud infrastructure, balancing options for cost, performance, reliability, and security with business needs. Consult with stakeholders to specify requirements and solutions which address business challenges and opportunities Create and support resources via infrastructure-as-code (IaC), including AWS networking and firewall tooling. Build automation tools and frameworks with CI/CD pipelines Create and maintain Security Policies, Standards, Guidelines and Controls to ensure protection of data, and proactive risk management Monitoring and management of cloud infrastructure solutions for optimal uptime, availability and scalability Troubleshoot issues with existing cloud-based applications and network resources to identify root causes and resolve issues quickly. Maintain business continuity and disaster recovery processes Actively participate in code reviews, tool evaluations, and architecture reviews. Promote and document best practices for cloud-based software development teams. Serve as a subject matter expert in cloud infrastructure, performing design reviews and consulting with your teams to ensure design best practices Qualifications Bachelor's degree or equivalent in Computer Science, Information Technology or Software Engineering. 3+ years designing, building, monitoring, and supporting cloud-based solutions. Expertise with infrastructure-as-code (IaC) - Terraform, CloudFormation or related Expertise with containerization - Docker, Kubernetes Expertise with CI/CD and DevOps toolchains Proficiency with Git and GitHub workflows Skilled in Python/Java/Go, Terraform/CloudFormation, Shell, Docker, Kubernetes, infrastructure as code Hands-on experience with AWS solutions Excellent debugging and troubleshooting skills Excellent verbal and written communication skills with an ability to present to both technical and non-technical stakeholders Nice to Haves Experience in designing and configuring network resources and diagnosing network-related issues, including TCP/IP subnetting, routing and packet capture/analysis, firewalls, and VPN solutions. Experience in security administration, including reviewing penetration testing results and vulnerability scan reports, hardening and securing systems, patch management, and forensics analysis. Experience in monitoring tools, such as New Relic, and/or Data Dog. Working knowledge of Windows and Unix/Linux Working knowledge of databases and SQL If you require alternative methods of application or screening, you must approach the employer directly to request this as Indeed is not responsible for the employer's application process.

Senior Software Engineer, Backend (Contract) - job post SoFi 108 reviews San Francisco, CA 94129 • Remote Contract You must create an Indeed account before continuing to the company website to apply Apply on company site save-icon Job details Encouraged to Apply Fair chance Job Type Contract Employee Applicant Privacy Notice Who we are: Shape a brighter financial future with us. Together with our members, we're changing the way people think about and interact with personal finance. We're a next-generation fintech company using innovative, mobile-first technology to help our millions of members reach their goals. The industry is going through an unprecedented transformation, and we're at the forefront. We're proud to come to work every day knowing that what we do has a direct impact on people's lives, with our core values guiding us every step of the way. Join us to invest in yourself, your career, and the financial world. The role We are seeking a Senior Software Engineer to join the Relay engineering team at SoFi, where we are designing for the future of personal finance. We are looking to helping our customers find their path to financial independence by providing them with the tools, resources, and guidance they need to get there. We want to be part of the customers financial journey by providing them timely insights, tailored to their needs, that will establish and build trust. Building this will involve taking a thoughtful and personalized approach towards every user's financial needs. The ideal candidate is collaborative, product-minded, and pragmatic, with a strong sense of ownership and accountability for the quality of both the code and finished product. At SoFi, we pride ourselves on the collaboration between Product, Design and Engineering and so you will be involved in the entire product lifecycle, from ideation through building, deploying and continual improvement and evolution. We also pride ourselves on a philosophy of continuous learning, and you should likewise be committed to furthering your own career growth as well as to providing mentorship for your fellow team members. What you'll do: Lead the development and testing of system components/services, code and design reviews Participate in shaping the technical architecture of the product Help translate product requirements into user stories and technical solutions Deliver highly available and scalable services in a production environment Mentor other engineers, support the technical culture, and help grow the team Generate ideas for new initiatives and technologies Communicate with project leads, product managers and other software developers What you'll need: Bachelor's Degree, ideally in a technical field, but we understand great engineers come from all sorts of different backgrounds and also consider relevant work experience 4+ years programming experience, ideally on a modern stack Our core stack is Kotlin / Spring / PostgreSQL, and we run on Kubernetes in a service oriented architecture with over 100 services in production. You should have 2+ years Java, Kotlin or Scala programming experience You should have a strong understanding of relational databases and ORMs You should have worked on a SOA or microservice-based application. Willingness to roll up your sleeves, collaborate with others and get stuff done Strong sense of responsibility; driving a project from inception to completion Affinity for solving problems and shipping impactful features, not polishing perfect code or architecture Experience working in a collaborative coding environment, refining designs together, working through code reviews and managing pull requests Nice to have: Interest in personal finance Experience managing your own investments or experience taking out loans Experience scaling highly available, mission critical systems Full-stack experience, either toward systems (kafka, docker, posix), databases (postgres), or front-end (javascript/typescript, react) Experience building data insight products Due to the temporary nature of the engagement, this position is not eligible for visa sponsorship Compensation and Benefits The base pay range for this role is listed below. Final base pay offer will be determined based on individual factors such as the candidate's experience, skills, and location. To view all of our comprehensive and competitive benefits, visit our Benefits at SoFi page! SoFi provides equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion (including religious dress and grooming practices), sex (including pregnancy, childbirth and related medical conditions, breastfeeding, and conditions related to breastfeeding), gender, gender identity, gender expression, national origin, ancestry, age (40 or over), physical or medical disability, medical condition, marital status, registered domestic partner status, sexual orientation, genetic information, military and/or veteran status, or any other basis prohibited by applicable state or federal law. New York applicants: Notice of Employee Rights SoFi is committed to embracing diversity. As part of this commitment, SoFi offers reasonable accommodations to candidates with physical or mental disabilities. Sr. Systems Engineer - FMEA (Remote) - job post Alten Technology USA 540 reviews San Francisco, CA • Remote $130,000 - $200,000 a year -  Contract Apply now Apply now save-icon Job details Salary $130,000 - $200,000 a year Job Type Contract Position: Sr. Systems Engineer Location: Petaluma, CA (remote) Duration: 12-month contract engagement. Annualized salary and benefits are offered for the duration of the contract through Alten Technology (medical, dental, vision, PTO, paid holidays, etc.). There is a strong possibility that this contract will be extended beyond the initial contract length. Note: Due to nature of work, only US Persons (citizens or permanent residents) need apply for this position. Who We Are: We’re ALTEN Technology USA, an engineering company that provides solutions for engineering, technology, and product development projects. For decades, we’ve been helping our clients develop products that are changing the world, whether that’s by shaping the future of space exploration, saving lives with medical devices that set a new standard of care, or creating the fully autonomous electric taxi of tomorrow. Our team of more than 600 people works across industries including aerospace, medical devices and life sciences, unmanned systems and robotics, automotive OEM and tier 1 suppliers, commercial vehicle, electric vehicles, rail, and more. Our offices across the US have different industry focuses and engage with our clients in different ways, ranging from working on-site at client facilities to performing product development at our delivery centers. ALTEN Group, our parent company, has been a leader in engineering and information technology for more than 30 years. ALTEN Group operates in 30 countries across Europe, North America, Asia, Africa and the Middle East and employs more than 36,000 people, 88% of whom are engineers. The company covers the whole development cycle and offers a choice of service levels, from technology consulting to complete project outsourcing. When you join ALTEN Technology USA, you join a group of people passionate about collaborating to solve some of the world’s most technical engineering challenges. Our success is tied to taking care of our employees by building relationships and providing opportunities for mentorship and career growth. We offer comprehensive benefits for all full-time employees, including medical, dental, and vision insurance; a 401(k) plan with employer matching; paid time off (PTO); paid parental leave; and mentorship to help you take your career to the next level. You don’t have to take our word for it that we’re a great place to work—we were named on the 2023 Top Workplaces list thanks to feedback from our proud employees. Summary The Senior Systems Engineer is responsible for the overall system design (architecture and interoperability requirements) for the Unmanned Air Vehicles and Ground Support Equipment. The Senior Systems Engineer works closely with equipment manufacturers, Engineering, and Program Management to select the appropriate equipment and ensure it will successfully integrate into the platform to meet the end customer’s requirements. This position is also a key resource for the development and review of specifications, CDRL’s, and ICD’s and assists both the Engineering and Flight Operations Departments to troubleshoot system integration, network protocol, and communication issues. Essential Duties and Responsibilities include the following. Other duties may be assigned. Engages with Program Manager and/or customer to understand current payload operations and emerging payload requirements. Creates and maintains necessary documentation, such as requirements, high-level design specifications, system limitations, and test plans. Maintains system configuration baselines and reviews Engineering Change Proposals Assists in the generation, evaluation and analysis of data items being generated including specifications, drawings, proposals, plans, cost estimates, SOWs, and reports. Assists in the review and analysis of proposals, specifications, and Interface Control Documents (ICDs). Works with internal and external customers leads to facilitate the resolution of technical issues, which may include formal root cause analysis efforts. Researches and evaluates vendor products, specifications, and manuals to determine appropriateness for application and feasibility of integration. Evaluates customer-provided documentation for compliance with requirements; and identifies system impacts, cost, schedule, and technical performance risks. Leads integration, verification, and validation activities for both internal and external projects and systems. Identifies, analyzes, and resolves system design weaknesses. Prepares technical presentations, and reports for technical design reviews/boards. Education/Experience Bachelor's Degree in a STEM (Science, Technology, Engineering or Math) field. 7 years of engineering experience with avionics in the aerospace or defense industries. Technical expertise in aerospace avionics systems to include payloads, communications, and guidance, navigation, and controls. Qualifications : The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skills, and/or abilities required. FMEA (Failure Modes and Effects Analysis), FMECA, FHA, Fault Tree, or SARS (Safety and Reliability Standards) experience required. Experience with signals intelligence technologies and sensors. Ability to walk around the facility on a regular basis to facilitate communication, coordinate tasks and resolve issues. Ability to work in an office and manufacturing environment (Constant). Required to sit and stand for long periods; talk, hear, and use hands and fingers to operate a computer and telephone keyboard (Frequent). Desired skills : Familiarity with aircraft transponder systems and operations. Strong troubleshooting skills and ability to resolve technical issues efficiently and independently. Proven success collaborating with Electrical, Software, Mechanical and other System Engineers to define system architecture and integration details. Experience in trade studies and requirements/interface definitions. Master’s degree in an Engineering field. Salary Range: $130-$200k If you require alternative methods of application or screening, you must approach the employer directly to request this as Indeed is not responsible for the employer's application process.

Stay current with new AWS services and features related to cloud database migration and incorporate them into migration plans as appropriate. Qualifications: Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or related field. 5+ years of experience in database administration, with a focus on cloud database migration. Extensive experience migrating Oracle Exadata and SQL Server databases to AWS RDS, including experience with terabytes of data. Experience with database replication and backup/restore strategies in a cloud environment. Knowledge of AWS services such as AWS Database Migration Service (DMS), AWS Schema Conversion Tool (SCT), and AWS CloudFormation. Strong understanding of database design, database security, and database performance optimization. Excellent problem-solving skills and ability to troubleshoot complex technical issues. Strong verbal and written communication skills, with the ability to communicate technical information to non-technical stakeholders. Preferred Qualifications: AWS Certification in Database Specialty or Solutions Architect. Experience with other cloud database migration tools and platforms. Experience with NoSQL databases such as DynamoDB. This is a part time (25 hours per week) 12 month contract role, you will be required onsite 2 – 3 days per week. Don’t meet every single requirement? We are dedicated to building a diverse, inclusive and authentic workplace, so if you’re excited about this role but your past experience doesn’t align perfectly with every qualification in the job description, we encourage you to apply anyways. You may be just the right candidate for this or other roles. Job Summary The Sr. Automation Engineer is responsible for operating and maintaining Automation/Control systems that support facilities. The individual will be responsible for providing Subject Matter Expertise (SME) for various Automation/Control systems including PLC’s, HMI’s, SCADA, BAS/BMS, vision systems, servo and motor controls, and associated infrastructure. Essential Duties and Responsibilities Technically review maintenance procedures. Prepare, maintain, and follow operating, security, and backup procedures for the systems and associated processes to adhere to cGMP’s, company, local, and state requirements. Review metrics on the system. Support shut down activities and scheduling of PM/repair work. Increase Automotive/Control system performance through identification of improvements. Monitor automation/control system performance through identification of improvements. Monitor automation/control equipment operation and implement corrective actions for out of specification operation and alarms. Support Quality Assurance investigations of Automation/Control issues. Coordinate breakdown repair activities Develop, conduct, and document test methods for systems troubleshooting. Facilitate completion of change control documentation. Develop training modules; provide coaching/feedback to develop/enhance technical personnel capabilities. Provide technical troubleshooting support to mechanics responding to breakdown Work with the customers/end users to identify process improvement projects. Develop scope and estimates, and manage projects to completion. Coordinate support activities such as equipment reconfiguration, change over, replacement planning, etc. Develop and Maintain documentation including User Requirements and Detailed Design Specifications. Maintain an up to date drawing of new and/or existing equipment, systems and processes. Work with Engineering Team to review specifications and provide input. Accept/Create turnover packages and establish maintenance programs. Support Qualification activities including protocol generation/review/execution. Qualifications and Requirements Bachelor’s Degree in electrical engineering or a related engineering field is required plus a minimum of 7 years experience in Pharmaceutical or similar regulated industry preferred. Must be proficient in the use of Microsoft Office Applications, including Microsoft Project, Word and Excel. Familiar with AutoCAD. Must have an understating of automation programming (visual basic, C++, ladder logic, structured text, etc.) Ability to clearly and concisely express thoughts in written procedures, protocols, and reports, to write procedures that clearly define, required tasks, to proofread other’s work for accuracy, and to generate presentations/reports to explain and/or analyze areas of responsibility. Comfortable working in production environment with multiple priorities. Works effectively as a team member or team leader. Understanding of engineering principles as they apply to facility and production equipment. Understanding of maintenance strategies and techniques. Understanding Continuous Improvement Principles. Experience with PLC’s and SCADA systems and equipment. Ability to specify and configure control equipment. Must have an understanding of automation programming (visual basic, C++, ladder logic, structured text, etc.) and demonstrated ability to program and debug/troubleshoot existing code. Knowledge of OSHA requirements and understanding of cGMP, GDP, and FDA requirements as they apply to automation. Ability to understand mechanical layouts and electrical/pneumatic schematics (P&ID’s). Bachelors, Masters or PhD in a related technical discipline (or equivalent experience). 10+ years industry experience. Expertise of the PHY/MAC layer procedures, expected behavior, and typical performance tradeoffs, as well as overall system performance . Background with LTE/5G MAC and PHY from both systems and low-level 3GPP spec point of view. Programming for design and development of wireless software including stellar debugging skills. Ability to switch between high-level systems view and low-level detail view of complex wireless systems. Comfortable using wireless lab equipment such as signal generators, network analyzers, power meters, etc. A bility to work as an individual contributor or take a technical leadership role SIMD based architecture use in signal processing is a plus. Knowledge of Massive MIMO impact on 5G radio access network is a plus. Exposure to CUDA/GPU programming is a plus.
